column7:
Working as an Engineer, I believe statistics play a big part in the root cause analysis of any problem. A phenomenon can be either explained or predicted using statistical data.

I work as a hardware engineer designing and testing complex hardware. When I started my job, I used to use a lot of 3-d simulation tools to help design the system. In an ideal world, if the design is perfect, the systems should work right away. But I found that, there are lots of variations involved in manufacturing a hardware. So, optimizing the parameters to have working margin and a better yield rather than building the best hardware.

To accomplish the above, I started gathering a lot of statistics and analyzing the results to come up with the best design. 

"A Gentle Introduction to Statistics" would help me to understand the data better.
column8:
70% of my job involves getting the statistical data and then finding patterns to root cause the failures and making the design better.
